page.title: 15Wildlife in the area iii
page.content: There are also many badgers and there is a badger sett in the downs, and another to the east of the school. They will go 6 miles in search of food. The area is a good habitat for badgers. Keepers shoot and gas foxes but they often escape wounded. Mrs Reynolds found a dead fox with fifteen shots in it. The vole population goes up and down but is up now. Voles earth up plants but they can be poked out of their holes and shot. There are some dormice but they are fast dying out. Warfarin is laid down for rats as it solidifies the blood. This area is a wildlife paradise except for the fact that there are no lakes, ponds or streams. So water creatures are rare particularly as the artificial ponds have disappeared. {(AUTHORS:W.Wingfield Digby, B.Reed.)
